smell_analysis.justification: All pages in the PDF contain diagrams with elements and connections; no empty diagrams were found.
All use cases in the diagrams (Pages 2 and 3) are associated with an actor, either directly or via inclusion by a use case that is connected to an actor.
No instances were found where a single actor is associated with multiple use cases sharing semantically identical names.
No package contains multiple model elements with the same name. Elements like 'Isik' or 'Auto' appear in different diagrams but belong to specific packages without internal duplication.
No obvious redundant data duplication without Foreign Keys was detected. Common columns like 'nimetus' appear in classifier tables, which is permitted by the rule.
All use cases follow a consistent naming convention (Imperative Verb + Noun), e.g., 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Registreeri auto'.
In the state diagram (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Unustatud, Lõpetatud) are reachable from the Start node.
In the activity diagram (Page 4), all actions are reachable via the defined decision paths.

On the class diagram 'Autode register (Klassifikaator)' (Page 12), the association between the class 'Auto' and the class 'Auto_kütuse_liik' is missing a multiplicity indicator at the 'Auto' end (expected '0..*' or similar, but no text is visible).
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The maximum count found was 9 tables on the 'Klassifikaatorite register' database diagram (Page 15).

On the database diagram 'Autode register' (Page 17), the table 'Auto' has exactly 6 visual connection lines connecting it to other tables (connections to Auto_mark, Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_omamine, and two separate connections to Tootaja).
The layout of elements across all diagrams is reasonably balanced, with no connected elements placed excessively far apart relative to the average distance.
All use cases and activity diagram actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri', 'Vali').
No central elements (classes, tables, use cases) with names of 3 or fewer characters were found. Smallest names like 'Isik', 'Riik', 'Auto' have 4 characters.
All class names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Töötaja').
All attribute and column names start with a lowercase letter (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'mudel', 'nimetus').
All database table names are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Kasutajakonto', 'Auto').
No type prefixes (Hungarian notation) were found in class, table, or attribute names.
